author: revelar
title: Duo - Brazilian Portuguese Gameplay
description: NFT based play-to-earn games often focus on natively English-speaking cultures, which diminishes the possibility of a rich global community.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is closely linked to the Challenge. It is a new proposal that will complement an already existing chosen project. The game Duo by Revelar, which is part of the Cardano ecosystem, will now be translated into other languages, here into Portuguese. Language translations help to expand the player community globally, which will have an immense impact on Cardano. The team is committed to ensuring that the translation is accurate and that the game experience is optimised. Players from the Portuguese-speaking world will be introduced to the Cadarno blockchain. NFT's cards will be used to create a play-to-earn experience tied to the Cardano Blockchain. The team has done a risk analysis and developed appropriate solutions to keep the risks low.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has chosen a rather short time frame for this task, which is divided into short work steps. Since it is an extension of already existing structures, it seems realistic to implement. The requested budget is reasonable. Overall, the team has the necessary references and has also demonstrated competence in the past.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team is committed to disclosure and encourages people to follow the project, development phases and achievements on their website https://www.getduo.gg/ and their Discord channel. All information, including that on previous projects, is neatly catalogued in Catalyst.
Personal contact can be made via an email address.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well aligned with the challenge. It demonstrates the need to diversify NFT based play-to-earn games to include non-English-speaking cultures, hence focusing creating a Blockchain layer that interacts with existing games. The proposal intends to create a huge global impact, promoting Cardano through games to non- English-speaking communities in the world. The project is highly scalable.
f6_assessments.q1: The media information provided and the team’s experience is reasonable. The methods, strategies, activities are defined and reasonable. The budget is reasonable and well explained. The risks taken into consideration and the expected outcome and impact surpasses the expected risk and cost.
f6_assessments.q2: A dedicated Revelar domain  https://catalyst.revelar.co will be provided to track real-time progress of the proposed activities. The KIPs, roadmap and milestone are well defined and measurable. The delivery dates are clearly defined.

f6_assessments.q0:
The main ideas and activities of the project are well written and align with the challenge. Through this idea, the project can attract gamers in communities around the world and increase diversity for the Cardano ecosystem.
The main risks involved in project implementation such as Lost in translation, Cultural translation, Remote collaboration risks, Product fit, are analyzed specifically and given specific solutions.
f6_assessments.q1:
The information about the feasibility section is quite complete and detailed. The members of CEO, CTO, CCO all have a lot of experience in the field related to the project. Detailed information about work experience, outstanding achievements as well as attached profiles (LinkedIn, Twitter, Discord) are all mentioned. The roadmap section is divided into logical subsections.
However, I think the information will be more complete for evaluation if the author can add information about completion time as well as unit cost per hour, number of interpreters required in the budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has clear quantifiable KPIs at each milestone to help define project success. 
Besides, readers can track project progress through updates on the website: https://catalyst.revelar.co. However, I think the author should add to the progress tracking section, the workloads are completed in a quantifiable way with a specific time. This way, the community will be able to rely on that information to compare project progress with the plan.
f6_assessments.reply:
Feasibility: The allocation of the budget at a more granular level is only possible once we begin the search for a translation team. Based on a quick search we did we saw that different translators have different lead times and hourly rates. We therefore though it prudent to put in a high level budget that describes the funding allocation without committing to specifics, and drop the amounts we are asking funding for. The shortfalls we will cover internally.
Auditability: Our website for tracking proposals presents more information that required, however we cannot present the time taken for each line-item yet as the work still needs to take place. That is why instead there is a week based timeline given.
While the review is well written, the issues raised do not match the loss of stars.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal’s goal is to translate the Duo’s first deck from English to Brazilian Portuguese. Duo, as a card game, could be quite easily translated to other games since the content is sizable, limited and well known. With this, the reach and therefore impact of the game would be increased to other communities, specially the Portuguese speaking community (focused in Brazil). This is a quite simple proposal, which aims at expand the impact of an already existing game. This is aligned with the challenge’s goals since it would increase the reach of the game and onboard new gamers that otherwise couldn’t be comfortable with entering this world. All the mapped risks make sense - since this is a joke based game, it’s not guaranteed that it would work in different languages because of many linguistic and cultural reasons, but it’s expected that the majority of the jokes would still work. To lower the impact of such a thing, it would be interesting to also include the original version in English, so some curious players could look for the right meaning, if they don’t understanding already in English. This team is proposing similar proposals to other languages, and for Portuguese I believe the impact is going to be big, since the gaming Community specially in Brazil is quite significant. This translation can really increase the impact of this game. [For QA: part of this assessment is similar to the assessment of their other translation proposals.]
f6_assessments.q1: The presented roadmap seems to be feasible for the execution of the plan, and it makes sense according to what was proposed to be developed. The budget is also well explained, but it looks quite low and seems to be short, but the team must have done some research to come up with these numbers, therefore they are probably enough to deliver the content. The proposing team from Revelar is well experienced in game development and they are known in the community. Although, the translator themselves are yet to be found, what adds a small uncertainty to the execution, but what shouldn’t represent any high risks to the timeline presented. [For QA: part of this assessment is similar to the assessment of their other translation proposals.]
f6_assessments.q2: The Revelar team keeps track of the development of their Catalyst funded proposals in a dedicated webpage, which is very good for auditability and easy to track. The success of the proposal is well described and there are KPIs to track it’s success after launch based on the number of new players from this new community. To make it better, I would also include some KPIs related to the sale of the translated NFTs, at least. At stated, this is not a continuation of a funded proposal, but it is attached to another ‘main’ proposal submitted in Catalyst in this same fund. It would be good to have better explained the relation between theses proposals, is this somehow depends on the main one getting funded or not. [For QA: part of this assessment is similar to the assessment of their other translation proposals.]

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal can cause a big impact to the Cardano ecossystem with the gamers because these people are engaged on new and technological ideas. That means that probably the gamers would accept and embrace more easily the game idea, and as gamers usually indicate their favorite games to their friends, it would be natural to spread this one.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience and formal education of these proposal members are plausible and coherent to make the project happen. But one thing that made me wonder is the time and the money requested to make each project phase happen. Is that enought only 2 weeks to find a translator and start a partnership with him? And is that enough 4 weeks to translate all the content? I do this same questioning for the other phases of the project. It's important to know that if the deadlines are wrong, the money requested also would be insufficient.
f6_assessments.q2: The project can be audited by the number of onboarding gamers from the target language and in the Discord server. The proposers made it clear explaining the goals using numbers and deadlines.
f6_assessments.reply: Feasibility: There are a number of services available that provide short lead times for finding translation services. Besides these there are also the working platforms such as upwork and fiverr that provide quality service, across the world with a very short lead time. I think the reviewer is judging us based on a subjective feeling that we need more time. I think that is rather unfair to do.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer is seeking to expand gameplay to reach many people through partnership with native speakers of different language and cultures and use NFT-based play-to-earn games to reach out to the natives, thus broadening the Cardano ecosystem through Cardano gameplay. 
The proposer believes that a more cohesive Cardano community is possible through the translation the translation of English-based NFT assets. I think this is very true and a laudable idea. Translating Duo, the NFT card game on Cardano, into a variety of common languages , not only enables people to experience utility-based NFT in their language but also provides a more diverse and enriched Cardano community. 
Duo is the flagship play-to-earn NFT game powered by Reveler. Duo brings together humor and CNFTs as an easy entry NFTs game in the next wave of gaming. Duo aims to bring more people into crypto and does so through humor. 
By porting game content across language and cultural barriers, more games from around the world are given access to a global community in a way that is familiar to them, and this addresses very well the challenge called Gamers on-changed. 
The risks associated with this proposal are listed in the proposal such as translation challenges, cultural translation, remote collaboration, product fit, to mention a few. However the proposers want to deliver the highest value with the least amount of technical complexity to grow the community. This proposal has put in a lot of effort and the social impact of creating humor for people through this Duo game can relieve a lot of people stress and related problems, thus making people happy for growth in the communities. My rating is 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The timeline and plan is clearly stated in weeks of activities such as 2 weeks for finding a partnership with a translator, 2-4 weeks for translating the content and creating new content if time allows, 2 weeks of generating new assets from the translated content, and 4 weeks of marketing and launching a game deck in the appropriate region relative to the content.
The budget breakdown is clear and understandable with costs allocated to translation services, REgional content creation, collection design overhead, Regional marketing for the new collection. However, with this laudable idea, the total budget requested amount of USD4750 somehow looks low but maybe their economy is not costly so I will not comment on it negatively. I think this is a great proposal and I recommend funding for it. If further funding is required they can ask in the Fund9 iteration.
f6_assessments.q2:
Reveler has a dedicated domain to all Catalyst proposals, so all live activities, history, real-time activities are all visible in their site , as well as final reports for easy auditing anytime. 
With this particular proposal, they have mentioned that they will create a Duo translation page for all content. 
Success can be seen in the completion of translated content. The metrics are on time delivery of translated and regional content, onboarding of gamers divided into 3 months - 100 new players, 6 months - 250 new players, 9-12 months - 500-1000 players.
This is a new proposal though Reveler has past proposals. My rating is 5 for this well organized write up which makes a nice read.

solution: Partner with native speakers of a different language and culture to expand gameplay reach to reach more people.
experience: The Revelar team is a known contributor & has received funding on several projects in previous Catalyst Funds. We have a growing team of experienced software architects & engineers from around the world, Plutus Pioneers, & startup experience to manage a bootstrapped project.
